response: "{ \"title\": \"Euler's Totient Function (Hard)\", \"description\": \"#### Problem\\nThe Euler totient function, denoted by \u03c6(n), is a fundamental arithmetic function that counts the positive integers up to a given number n that are relatively prime to n.\\nWrite a function `euler_totient` that calculates the Euler totient function for a given input `n`. The input will be an integer between 1 and 1000000, inclusive. The function should return the value of the Euler totient function for the given input `n`\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef euler_totient(n: int) -> int:\\n```\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): An integer between 1 and 1000000, inclusive.\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the value of the Euler totient function for the given input `n`\\n\", \"code\": \"import math\\n\\ndef euler_totient(n: int) -> int:\\n    result = n\\n    p = 2\\n    while p * p <= n:\\n        if n % p == 0:\\n            while n % p == 0:\\n                n //= p\\n            result -= result // p\\n        else:\\n            p += 1\\n    if n > 1:\\n        result -= 1\\n    return result\", \"tests\": [\"assert euler_totient(10) == 4\", \"assert euler_totient(36) == 12\", \"assert euler_totient(1000000) == 400000\", \"assert euler_totient(2) == 1\"] }"
